root_causes: Script references variable B5eDKx1 but expected validation target is B5eDKx1_5 (missing the _5 suffix).
Script uses a DO REPEAT over B5eDKx1 B5eDKx2 B5eDKx3 B5eDKx4 so this single-question script is checking multiple variables instead of only the intended variable.
The selection condition (~any(v,5)) is applied to each repeated variable; this is inconsistent with the expected single-target check of the answer code '5' for B5eDKx1_5.
No handling or guidance for special codes (e.g. 97/98/99) is present; while not in the expected logic, verify whether such codes should be treated as missing/exempt.
instructions: Validate the correct variable: use B5eDKx1_5 (the indicator for answer code 5) rather than B5eDKx1.
Do not use DO REPEAT across all four items for this question. Replace the DO REPEAT block with a single check on B5eDKx1_5.
If B5eDKx1_5 is an indicator variable (1 = selected), use: temporary. sel if miss(B5eDKx1_5) or B5eDKx1_5 <> 1. list respid B5eDKx1_5.

If instead the original multi-response variable stores raw codes (B5eDKx1 contains option codes), then explicitly check that variable only: temporary. sel if miss(B5eDKx1) or ~any(B5eDKx1,5). list respid B5eDKx1. (But do not iterate over the other items.)

Confirm and document how special codes (97/98/99) should be handled; if they should be treated as missing/exempt, include them in the selection condition (e.g. sel if miss(B5eDKx1_5) or B5eDKx1_5 in (97,98,99) or B5eDKx1_5 <> 1).

root_causes: Script references variable B5eDKx2 only as part of a DO REPEAT over B5eDKx1..B5eDKx4 instead of targeting B5eDKx2_5 (expected).
Incorrect variable name: expected B5eDKx2_5 but script uses B5eDKx2 (no _5).
Selection logic (~any(v,5)) is applied generically across repeated variables rather than validating the specific answer-code presence for B5eDKx2_5.
No explicit treatment of potential special codes (97/98/99).
instructions: Target the correct variable B5eDKx2_5 rather than using B5eDKx2 inside a DO REPEAT.
Remove the DO REPEAT for this question; perform a single-variable check such as: temporary. sel if miss(B5eDKx2_5) or B5eDKx2_5 <> 1. list respid B5eDKx2_5.
If the dataset stores codes in B5eDKx2 (not an indicator), then check that variable only: temporary. sel if miss(B5eDKx2) or ~any(B5eDKx2,5). list respid B5eDKx2. Do not iterate over other items.
Decide how to handle special codes (97/98/99) and add them to the selection condition if they should be excluded or treated as missing.

root_causes: Script uses DO REPEAT over B5eDKx1..B5eDKx4 instead of validating only B5eDKx3_5 (expected target).
Wrong variable referenced: B5eDKx3 expected as B5eDKx3_5 but script references B5eDKx3 (no _5).
Generic ~any(v,5) check across repeated vars does not correspond to the specified validation for the item-specific answer code 5.
No special-code handling included.
instructions: Validate the specific variable B5eDKx3_5. Replace the DO REPEAT with a single check against B5eDKx3_5.
If B5eDKx3_5 is an indicator (1 = selected), use: temporary. sel if miss(B5eDKx3_5) or B5eDKx3_5 <> 1. list respid B5eDKx3_5.
If raw codes are stored in B5eDKx3, check only that variable: temporary. sel if miss(B5eDKx3) or ~any(B5eDKx3,5). list respid B5eDKx3.
Confirm handling of special codes (97/98/99) and update the selection condition accordingly.

root_causes: Script checks all four variables via DO REPEAT rather than focusing on the expected B5eDKx4_5 variable.
Incorrect variable referenced: B5eDKx4 used instead of B5eDKx4_5.
Validation condition (~any(v,5)) is applied generally rather than ensuring the item-specific answer code 5 is validated for B5eDKx4_5.
No mention or handling of special codes (97/98/99).
instructions: Use B5eDKx4_5 as the validation target and remove the DO REPEAT loop for this question.
If B5eDKx4_5 is a binary indicator (1 = selected), implement: temporary. sel if miss(B5eDKx4_5) or B5eDKx4_5 <> 1. list respid B5eDKx4_5.
If the raw multi-response is stored in B5eDKx4, check that variable only: temporary. sel if miss(B5eDKx4) or ~any(B5eDKx4,5). list respid B5eDKx4.
Decide and implement handling for any special codes (97/98/99) if applicable.

root_causes: Wrong variable referenced: script uses B5eDKx1 but expected checkbox variable is B5eDKx1_5
Wrong value tested: script checks for value 5 (range(...,5,5)) but the sub-variable for a multi/checkbox is typically coded 1 when selected and should be tested for 1
Validation logic does not reflect multi/checkbox variable structure (should validate the _5 sub-variable)
instructions: Use the checkbox-specific variable B5eDKx1_5 instead of B5eDKx1 in all checks and listings.
Test for selection on the _5 variable (usually coded 1 when checked). For example: temporary. sel if miss(B5eDKx1_5) or ~range(B5eDKx1_5,1,1). list respid B5eDKx1_5.

If your data actually stores the answer code 5 on a non-suffixed variable, confirm that naming convention and update the expected Variable ID; otherwise correct the script to reference the _5 variable.
If there are special codes (97/98/99) used in this survey, explicitly include them in the validation logic as needed (e.g., treat them as valid or exclude them from missing checks).
